title: What advantages fostered the Renaissance in Italy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here's one you're not likely to hear right away: two and a half centuries before the start of the Italian Renaissance, the Holy Roman Emperor invited Jewish scholars to take up residence in four or five southern Italian cities to translate the Greek classics, then extant only in Arabic, to Latin. The “pagan” reeducation of Europe had thus begun. While it may have meant the beginning of the Renaissance in Italy, it also marked the end of Scholasticism.
